vote.title: Authorize the (1) application for and acceptance of the Commercial Auto Theft Interdiction Squad/28 Grant (Grant No. 608-21-DPD0000) from the Motor Vehicle Crimes Prevention Authority (MVCPA) in the amount of $625,000.00 to provide a specialized proactive automobile theft program, for the period September 1, 2020 through August 31, 2021; (2) establishment of appropriations in an amount not to exceed $625,000.00 in the FY21 MVCPA -Commercial Auto Theft Interdiction Squad/28 Fund; (3) receipt and deposit of funds in an amount not to exceed $625,000.00 in the FY21 MVCPA-Commercial Auto Theft Interdiction Squad/28 Fund; (4) a local match in an amount not to exceed $137,939.00; (5) an in-kind contribution in an approximate amount of $637,833.51; and (6) execution of the grant agreement and all terms, conditions, and documents required by the grant agreement - Total not to exceed $1,400,772.51 - Financing: Motor Vehicle Crimes Prevention Authority Grant Funds ($625,000.00) and General Fund ($775,772.51) (subject to appropriations) (see Fiscal Information)
vote.description: Authorize the (1) application for and acceptance of the Commercial Auto Theft Interdiction Squad/28 Grant (Grant No. 608-21-DPD0000) from the Motor Vehicle Crimes Prevention Authority (MVCPA) in the amount of $625,000.00 to provide a specialized proactive automobile theft program, for the period September 1, 2020 through August 31, 2021; (2) establishment of appropriations in an amount not to exceed $625,000.00 in the FY21 MVCPA -Commercial Auto Theft Interdiction Squad/28 Fund; (3) receipt and deposit of funds in an amount not to exceed $625,000.00 in the FY21 MVCPA-Commercial Auto Theft Interdiction Squad/28 Fund; (4) a local match in an amount not to exceed $137,939.00; (5) an in-kind contribution in an approximate amount of $637,833.51; and (6) execution of the grant agreement and all terms, conditions, and documents required by the grant agreement - Total not to exceed $1,400,772.51 - Financing: Motor Vehicle Crimes Prevention Authority Grant Funds ($625,000.00) and General Fund ($775,772.51) (subject to appropriations) (see Fiscal Information)
